concept.title: The role of a style guide GEORGE
concept.shortdesc: A style guide provides advice on the optimal use of approaches, procedures and processes. A DITA style guide focusses on best practice application of the DITA standard.

conbody.p: The primary purpose of a style guide is to promote consistency. Style guides also aim to codify best practice. What the term best practice actually means is not universally understood or agreed. Understanding what constitutes best practice in DITA is made more challenging by the difficulty in finding agreed practices in this field, let alone best practice. Something as simple as whether paragraphs should exist within list items is not clear-cut.

It is just as easy to lazily create poorly marked-up DITA documents as it is to create poorly styled word processing documents. To maximise the opportunities of DITA, it is important that the semantic elements are applied consistently across a publications department, and indeed across the DITA authoring community.
is intended to serve as an authoritative reference that defines a best practice conventions for mark-up, writing style, naming, and structure.

section.title: Rationale

lq.reftitle: Molly Riddell, LinkedIn Content Wrangler Community discussion

section.lq: My biggest tip is never to assume that DITA/XML will naturally converge different authors to greater consistency or minimalism-- it is just as easy to develop poorly-written (and structured!) content within the guidelines of DITA as it is within a DTP environment. What I would recommend is to focus also on developing a useful and comprehensive style guide that clearly defines preferred writing style and structure, with specific, illustrative examples of how the content should be marked up across different topics. In any implementation, it is expected that there are at least several different authors-- so it is also helpful to establish consistent conventions for topic naming and versioning. This can ensure that information is easily navigated and tracked, no matter who is editing it.
